attributes.review: This app had events that were months pasts, news articles that would completely glitch out or made no sense. Itâ€™s as if a kindergartner created this app and tried to sell it off as President trumps. The layout is ugly, the buttons takes forever to process when youâ€™ve touched them, making the whole app freeze up. Itâ€™s more of a hassle then just going online. And, not only that, but it took hours upon hours to download. From the reviews it seems like Iâ€™m not the only one. This whole app is a scam, and it completely wasted my time. Itâ€™s infuriating that I even gave a sh*t after hours of faith.

attributes.review: It didnâ€™t quite take me as long to download the app as some other reviews Iâ€™ve read, but the installation process really dragged its feet. Once the app finally downloaded, it asked for my phone number BEFORE even asking for my name (suuuper sketchy). I entered those ten magical digits, then waited for the verification code to send... and waited... and waited... until I gave up and deleted the app. My hypothesis is that Mr. Donald rounded up some Trump University freshmen and assigned them the overly ambitious task of developing a functioning app. I donâ€™t usually give 1-star reviews. If an app adds ANY positivity to my day I make sure to give it at least 3 stars. But alas, this app did not.
